title: How to Add Annotations in Word

steps.title: Open the document with which you will be working.
steps.content: Open the document with which you will be working.

steps.title: Save the document as a new file with a different file name before you add annotations.
steps.content: Save the document as a new file with a different file name before you add annotations. This is to preserve the original file.

steps.title: Enable the Markup feature to annotate in Word.
steps.content: Enable the Markup feature to annotate in Word. In Word 2003, you will find this under the "View" menu. In Word 2007 or 2010, click on the Review tab on the menu or ribbon and select "Comments" under the "Show Markup" drop-down box.

steps.title: Highlight the text that you need to annotate in Word by clicking and dragging to select a word or series of words.
steps.content: Highlight the text that you need to annotate in Word by clicking and dragging to select a word or series of words.

steps.title: Insert a comment.
steps.content: Insert a comment. In Word 2003, click the Insert menu and choose "Comment." In Word 2007 or 2010, click "New Comment" in the Comments section of the Review tab. Type out your comment and press the ESC key to close it. Edit or delete comments by right-clicking on them and either choosing "Delete" or altering the text.
